values: Like in the "send a message" clicky thing? I have a friend who I have no other way to contact anymore, and I wanted to tell him something. He hasn't been on livejournal is 147 weeks (Yeesh, some people, huh? *wink*) so I was wondering if he'll get an email saying that he has a message from me, or just a generic email that he has a message, or no email at all? Anyone know?
Pretty much all of my entries are friends only. Just so that you know.

Update for the kiddies!
We have another group on the list, and I will be stopping by to drop gifts off this weekend, so let me know if you can help. 

6 month old girl
2 year old boy
6 year old girl
8 year old boy
11 year old girl
13year old boy
15 year old girl
17 year old boy

you'll feel AWESOME! Seriously! And just think of all of the extra room you get when you clean things out!

I have "adopted" some kids this year who are having rough winters. I KNOW that some of you have kids, and having kids means having boxes of clothes/toys that your child has outgrown sitting down in the basement. These need not be new toys. They will still be new to the little ones. They SHOULD have all of the pieces, however. 

Things that would really help are:

Clothes for a 7 month old little girl, a 6 and 4 year old girl.

Clothes for an 8, 2 and 1 year old boy.

Toys for any of those ages (particularly learning toys).

Help with Christmas dinner for a family of 5.

My son is LOVING going through all of his stuff and picking what he gives as a "Santa's Helper". It is even getting him to clean his room. 

Those of you without kids but who still want to help, that family dinner is open. It is a single dad who just lost his job... He does cook a bit, so food can just be brought up or prepared.

Thanks so much, guys. Remember, the spirit of Christmas is in the GIVING, not the receiving.

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In March I broke 's X-Box (-12 points). Last Saturday and I donated clothes to the needy (11 points). In September I ruled Duluth, Minnesota as a kind and benevolent dictator (700 points). Last Sunday I gave change to a homeless guy (19 points). Last Tuesday I helped hide a body (-173 points).

Overall, I've been nice (545 points). For Christmas I deserve a new bike!

Sincerely,
diana_gossford

1) What rank would have in a giant robot army? Private (ie boot shiner) until he showed his stuff, then Major General, of course. (It would take 2 days max.)

28) How would conquer the world? She'd take over the army by seducing them with pin up pictures, and then use them to bend the rest of the world to her will. Hey, can I be a groupy?

30) Does go to your school? No, but he went to the same high school.

It was snowing in Times Square, at night. How lovely. (Took this with my camera phone, so sorry about the quality, but it WAS such a lovely sight.)

I will update  you all soon on the trip... but I wanted to let everyone know that I am home now.
I am already missing being there more than I would have imagined... I made some very good friends and the people that I stayed with became like family. I can't wait to go back, which incidently isn't very long away. I may be needed back there as early as mid May... 
It will get harder and harder to leave each time I go.
Perhaps one day I just wont... *smile softly*
I never want to leave New York.

I've never been much concerned about growing older, although perhaps
it is the blessed way in which I never seem to look or feel much
older. Those things that are our curses also make our blessings
eventually. *smile* At one time I was struggling somuch to make
people SEE me as an adult. At nearly 27 I still struggle with it,
but it no longer bothers me. Those things which make us up finally
bond within us if we are able to accept them.
At any rate, I wanted to thank all of you who have helped make these
last few years so special. The making of art was always the goal,
but the appreciation of that art somehow make the toil more worth it
than I had envisioned at the beginning. I hope to have all of you
with me again next year, and the year after that. May this year
bring us all untold blessings! Much love~ Diana

YOUR FRESHMAN YEAR OF HIGH SCHOOL.

[What year was it?]
1992

[What were your three favorite bands?]
Erasure, The Smiths, U2

[What was your favorite outfit?]
Pleated skirt, polo top or button up shirt and v neck sweater usually tied around the neck.

[What was up with your hair?]
Same thing as now, but with more bangs. Long, blonde, straight.

[Who was your best friend?]
Jason. We started dating 2 weeks into my freshman year and continued for all 4 years of high school.

[What did you do after school?]
Drama club. Then time with Jason.

[Where did you work?]
I babysat still, but no place would really hire you out here til you were 16.

[Did you take the bus?]
About 1/2 of the time. Jason would come and pick me up to take me to school sometimes, then go to work and his school in the afternoon.

[Who did you have a crush on?]
Well, sort of Grant Simpson. Other than that, just Jason.

[Did you fight with your parents?]
Like the Isrealis and Palestinians.

[Who did you have a CELEBRITY crush on?]
Christian Slater. 
And what do you mean "did"?

[Did you smoke cigarettes?]
No, not even one.

[Did you lug all of your books around in your backpack all day because you were too nervous to find your locker?]
No, I lugged everything around because the locker was too far away to be functional. 

[Did you have a 'clique'?]
Not really. Same as I am now... I had lots of "friends" but wasn't a part of any one group.

[Did you have a "Max" like Zach Kelly and Slater?]
It's like you are speaking a different language.

[Admit it, were you popular?]
Freshman year? Hmm... I guess so. I was dating an older guy that most people knew, I was one of the only freshman accepted into the "drama circle" and I was at least fairly cute...but I was mostly popular with the older classes. I knew them better.

[Who did you want to be just like?]
Well, me, I guess. 
Or Princess Grace.

[What did you want to be when you grow up?]
OBGYN or marine zoologist, specializing in marine mammals.
What I really wanted to be was an actress, of course, but I still wanted to go to school. The OBGYN was more for if I was forced to get into medicine.

[Where did you think you'd be at the age you are now?]
On the big screen

[What advice would you give your freshman self?]
Don't let Jason go.
These 4 years can set up the rest of your life if you let them.
Get involved in film NOW.

More background.
My mother is a teacher. I have watched with horror as the students have taken control of the schools and education system in this country over the last decade. when I was a kid all a teacher had to do was make one phone call to my mother and NO punishment at school would have been needed. My mother would have made very sure that "that kind of behavior" was never seen again.
Now days, you call home and get yelled at as a teacher, about how you are being too hard on the kid, or not doing your job. A child comes home angry at a teacher for saying he needed to look deeper or try harder and mom calls the principle yelling about how the teacher hurt her son's feelings and made him feel stupid. No one in fact usually asks the teacher anymore what happened before deciding what to do. I kid you not. 
It is a "Teacher's" job to "TEACH", not to raise. It is also not a teacher's job to coddle the sensitive sentiments of your child. Part of school is socialization. When are your children going to learn about the real world? When they get that first job? Boy, I think I would much rather have learned those lessons when they didn't count quite as much, not when I was getting fired because I felt that "every answer is part right" or that because it hurt my feelings no one should ever expect me to work harder. By the time you get to high school you should be learning what the REAL world will expect from you, and I don't think many bosses will be as forgiving as those teachers are today. Geez!
So, I would have given quite a lot to have seen the faces of the parents who called the school.
(This is hilarious, no wonder some people were
  offended!) This is the message that the Pacific
  Palisades High School (California) Staff voted
  unanimously to record on their school telephone
  answering machine. This came about because they
  implemented a policy  requiring students and parents to be responsible
  for their children's absences and  missing homework.

  The school and teachers are being sued by parents
  who want their children's failing grades changed  to passing grades even though those children were
  absent 15-30 times during the semester and did
  not complete enough school work to pass their
  classes.

  This is the actual answering machine message for
  the school:

  "Hello! You have reached the automated answering
  service of your school. In order to assist you in
  connecting the right staff member, please listen
  to all your options before making a selection:

  "To lie about why your child is absent - Press 1

  "To make excuses for why your child did not do
  his work- Press 2

"To complain about what we do - Press 3

  "To swear at staff members - Press 4

  "To ask why you didn't get information that was
  already enclosed in your newsletter and several
  flyers mailed to you - Press 5

  "If you want us to raise your child - Press 6

  "If you want to reach out and touch, slap or hit
  someone - Press 7

  "To request another teacher for the third time
  this year- Press 8

  "To complain about bus transportation - Press 9

  "To complain about school lunches - Press 0

  "If you realize this is the real world and your
  child must be accountable and responsible for
  his/her own behavior, class work, homework, and that
  it's not the teachers' fault for your
  child's lack of effort: Hang up and have a nice
  day!"

Once again.
The guy they are questioning has 3 roles in this. 1. Secretary General of the UN. (Ghanaian, and heavily French backed, although the US backed him too.) 2.Appointor of the gentleman who gets to investigate the Oil for Food scandal. 3. Father of one of the guys being investigated.
Wait, what was that?
Yup, you heard right! His first born bouncing baby boy is being put under the microscope, and he got to pick who looked into it. Daddy has been questioned 3 times, but they still haven't put forth formal charges because of lack of "evidence". Now, we have Saddam's records which definitavely state who was involved and we have money trails. Whatever is left to prove should be done it court. I get more and more angry with UN politics. Grr!
(Read this one too.  It'll explain my frusterations a bit more. http://www.opinionjournal.com/editorial/feature.html?id=110004801 )

Annan Questioned Three Times in Oil-For-Food Probe

5 minutes ago   World - Reuters 
 

By Evelyn Leopold 


UNITED NATIONS (Reuters) - U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan (news - web sites) was on Tuesday questioned for a third time by the commission investigating the scandal-tainted Iraq (news - web sites) oil-for-food program, a U.N. spokesman said. 


 

 

   

Annan has appointed Paul Volcker, the former chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve (news - web sites), to lead a probe of the $67 billion program, set up in late 1996 to allow civilian goods into Iraq in an effort to ease the impact of U.N. sanctions. 


"He has met more than once for an extended period of time with Mr. Volcker and his investigators," U.N. spokesman Fred Eckhard said in answer to queries. 


He originally said two interviews took place last year but later updated the information, saying the latest round was on Tuesday afternoon and lasted one hour and 35 minutes. Previous interviews were conducted on Nov. 9 for one hour and 45 minutes and on Dec. 3 for 25 minutes. 


"Yes, the secretary-general is part of the investigation, is subject like anyone else involved in oil-for-food in the secretariat," Eckhard said. "He has been questioned and most likely will continued to be questioned as Mr Volcker's investigation continues." 


The spokesman said the meetings took place in Annan's office at U.N. headquarters. Volcker is due to give a preliminary report at the end of the month or early in February. 


Among the allegations is that Kojo Annan, the U.N. leader's son, was paid a total of $125,000 by Geneva-based firm Cotecna, which inspected goods coming to Iraq. U.N. officials have denied Annan was aware or involved in contract negotiations. 


The payments were part of an agreement for the younger Annan, who worked in West Africa rather than Iraq, not to join a firm competing with Cotecna after he left the company, Eckhard said previously 


Since the end of the war, Iraq has released lists of oil vouchers and kickbacks by the former Iraqi government. The lists disclose legitimate contracts to oil companies but they are also a veritable who's who of political groups and individuals from whom the former Iraqi government wanted to buy influence to get sanctions lifted. 


CIA (news - web sites) weapons inspector Charles Duelfer, in a report in October, said Saddam reaped some $1.7 billion by subverting the program. Iraq also sold $8 billion in oil outside of the program, to Jordan, Syria and Turkey, which the Security Council, including the United States, knew about. 


Volcker said earlier this month his probe has not turned up a smoking gun. 


"You know his son was employed by this company, you know he knew his son was employed by the company, you know a few other things, but suppose you have no evidence Kofi influenced the process," Volcker told the New York Times. 


"You find an e-mail, or somebody who's squealing, then you have the proof, but without it you're left with the difficult task of trying to prove a negative," Volcker said. 


More recently Samir Vincent, 64, a naturalized U.S. citizen, pleaded guilty in New York of taking millions of dollars from Saddam Hussein (news - web sites)'s government in exchange for lobbying U.S. and U.N. officials. 


Vincent is the first known suspect who can shed light on how Saddam subverted and worked around the program and Volcker has asked to interview him.

I Am A: Chaotic Good Elf Mage Ranger

Alignment:
Chaotic Good characters are independent types with a strong belief in the value of goodness. They have little use for governments and other forces of order, and will generally do their own things, without heed to such groups.

Race:
Elves are the eldest of all races, although they are generally a bit smaller than humans. They are generally well-cultured, artistic, easy-going, and because of their long lives, unconcerned with day-to-day activities that other races frequently concern themselves with. Elves are, effectively, immortal, although they can be killed. After a thousand years or so, they simply pass on to the next plane of existance.

Primary Class:
Mages harness the magical energies for their own use. Spells, spell books, and long hours in the library are their loves. While often not physically strong, their mental talents can make up for this.

Secondary Class:
Rangers are the defenders of nature and the elements. They are in tune with the Earth, and work to keep it safe and healthy.
